Yesterday, North Carolina Governor, Roy Cooper announced that NC Schools may choose to utilize Plan B to reopen schools on August 17. Ashe County Schools leadership are currently finalizing what Plan B (https://www.asheschools.org/Page/6185) will look like in our schools. We know Plan B could present challenges for our families and we are exploring ways to better serve all of our students in grades Pre-K through 12.

Protocols will be in place under this plan for social distancing, facial coverings, and extra cleaning of facilities. As always, our number one priority will be the safety of our students and our staff.

We are excited to offer a Virtual Academy option to those parents who would like their students to learn from home. We will have more information available soon and will be in contact with those parents that indicated this choice on the survey.

We appreciate everyone’s patience as we finalize our plan and we are excited about the opportunity to have our students back in school both in person and virtually.

Mrs. Phyllis Yates, Superintendent of Ashe County Schools is retiring effective July 1, 2020. To keep with social distancing guidelines, on Thursday, June 25th, the Board of Education will sponsor a drive through celebration to honor Mrs. Yates. We invite and encourage all of our current and previous students, staff, parents, along with our Ashe County community to celebrate with Mrs. Yates and “drive by” the Central Support Services office located at 320 South Street, Jefferson between 12:30 and 2:30. Students are encouraged to write notes or draw pictures and post them on the bus located at the CSS that day. The Ashe County Art Tribe will assist students in leaving their hand prints on a congratulatory banner. The route begins at the intersections of Main Street and South Street and continues past Fletcher Memorial Church to 320 South Street and exits left on Ivy Street. Look for the signs and come join us in celebrating Mrs. Yates!!

Please share and help us spread the word. Thanks so much for your help!!!

CSS Staff

A message from ASHE COUNTY SCHOOLS

A state-wide conference call with all superintendents was held this afternoon and there are still lots of unanswered questions. The one thing we know for sure is that schools are closed March 16-30 for instructional purposes. For planning purposes, tomorrow will be a required teacher workday. Superintendents are to receive more information in the next 24-48 hours, so we should know more soon what all this means for staff, the continuation of instruction, student meals, etc. I know it’s hard to plan when you don’t have definitive answers—this is definitely new territory for all of us. I do believe it is good practice for families to follow the guidance from the Governor’s office and the Department of Health and Human Services on social distancing to help deter the spread of the virus. Thank you for your understanding and patience—I will be back in touch tomorrow.

Superintendent Yates.

The one thing we know for sure is that schools are closed March 16-30 for instructional purposes. For planning purposes, tomorrow will be a required teacher workday. Superintendents are to receive more information in the next 24-48 hours, so we should know more soon what all this means for staff, the continuation of instruction, student meals, etc. I know it’s hard to plan when you don’t have definitive answers—this is definitely new territory for all of us. I do believe it is good practice for families to follow the guidance from the Governor’s office and the Department of Health and Human Services on social distancing to help deter the spread of the virus. Thank you for your understanding and patience—I will be back in touch tomorrow.

Superintendent Yates.
